timeline.message: Impl CodeSystem $validate-code for R4 with basic test cases
Added more test cases for R4
Changed fetch size to 1 for CodeSystem $validate-code
CodeSystem/$validate-code not supported for DSTU2, DSTU3

timeline.bodyText: Minor suggestion: Create a unit test to validate that an exception is thrown for this method just to ensure that this does not bring down our test coverage statistics.
timeline.author: IanMMarshall

replies.bodyText: For dust2, CodeSystem Resource does not exists. Can't create test case.
replies.author: frankjtao

timeline.bodyText: Minor suggestion: Create a unit test to validate that an exception is thrown for this method just to ensure that this does not bring down our test coverage statistics.
timeline.author: IanMMarshall

timeline.bodyText: Maybe consider moving this method to a common dao package-level utility so as to avoid dependency on a version-specific dao class.
timeline.author: IanMMarshall

timeline.bodyText: Maybe consider moving this method to a common dao package-level utility so as to avoid dependency on ValueSet class.
timeline.author: IanMMarshall

replies.bodyText: The import is not needed, it's removed from the class
replies.author: frankjtao

timeline.bodyText: See my comments above about moving these two methods to a common dao utility. I think we should avoid dependencies between FHIR versions and between ValueSet and CodeSystem classes.
timeline.author: IanMMarshall

timeline.bodyText: This method maybe could also be moved into a dao package level utility .
timeline.author: IanMMarshall

replies.bodyText: This is provider level class, it's already in the ca.uhn.fhir.jpa.provider package.  Please check the package ca.uhn.fhir.jpa.provider . All classes under this package has Dstu2 at the end. I just followed the class name pattern. I don't think we need rename all the classes under this package
replies.author: frankjtao

timeline.bodyText: Should this not create a failure CodeValidationResult instead of throwing an exception? This could be considered a validation failure as opposed to an error in usage of the $validate-code operation like the previous exceptions.
timeline.author: IanMMarshall

replies.bodyText: InvalidRequestException and createFailureCodeValidationResult are different. InvalidRequestException is at the request level, and createFailureCodeValidationResult  is at the result level according to the FHIR spec. I followed the code pattern of ValueSet/$validate-code, please review validateCode() method for valueSet at same class of line 1737
replies.author: frankjtao

timeline.bodyText: Once again, I would argue that this could potentially be considered a validation failure rather than a usage error and therefore should result in the creation of a failure CodeValidationResult instead of throwing an exception.
timeline.author: IanMMarshall

timeline.bodyText: Suggestion: Would include a JUnit fail() statement after this statement, just in case the exception is not thrown as expected.
timeline.author: IanMMarshall

timeline.bodyText: Very impressed by the thoroughness of your testing. Nice!

timeline.bodyText: To maintain the current level of test coverage, we either need to add a test for this or perhaps remove this case since CodeSystem code-validation is not being supported for DSTU2 and DSTU3.

replies.bodyText: Removed DSTU2, and DSTU2_1 since there is no CodeSystem resource for the FHIR version. Added test case for DTU3

timeline.message: Added invalid test cases for CodeSystem/$validate-code R3
Added fail(); in the invalid test cases
Added invalid test cases for DSTU3

timeline.bodyText: I think I may have missed this in my previous review. I think the above import should be for the r5 IdType.
